result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle C Mcquillan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Collected by the clerk of courts
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle C Mcquillan

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek post conviction relief

3:15 pm cases 21CF859, 22CM671 called. Defendant Kyle Curtis Mcquillan in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for Kyle Curtis Mcquillan.  Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
There is an agreement. The State asks the DAGP be revoked in 21CF859 and the Court finds the defendant Guilty of Resisting/Failing to Stop based on his previously entered plea of Guilty.  
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 in 22CM671: Misdemeanor Bail Jumping. 
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant Guilty and revokes the DAGP in 21CF859 and finds the defendant Guilty of Resisting/Failing to Stop. 
Court orders defendant to pay court costs on each count including the DNA sample surcharge.

Attorney David Field - at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100.00 beginning 10/21/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

10:17 AM Defendant Kyle C Mcquillan in court without counsel.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant filled out the application for a court appointed attorney and requests new dates. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/12/22 at 3:15pm
Hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Conditions: 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

(11:14 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kyle C Mcquillan appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Kyle C Mcquillan.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on August 29, 2022 at 2:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
